newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Foster's brewed under licence in Spain.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Foster's brewed under licence in Spain.

text.p: Philippines brewer San Miguel Corp has begun to make Foster's beer on licence in Spain, the Foster's Brewing Group Ltd (FBG) said on Monday.
The arrangement to brew Foster's beer at San Miguel's Lerida brewery near Barcelona is aimed at tapping one of the continent's biggest and most rapdily growing markets, FBG said.
"The licensing arrangement with San Miguel is the latest link in the European brewing circle for Foster's," it said.
Foster's is also brewed in Sweden, Germany, Britain and Ireland.

FBG said it expected total sales in Europe to exceed four million hectolitres, or 50 million cases, by the end of June. This compares with 2.7 million hectolitres, or 34 million cases, in the year to June 30, 1993, the company said.
Spain is traditionally a wine-drinking nation, but beer consumption has grown in recent years, and Spain is now Europe's third biggest beer market, FBG said.
The licensing deal was executed by Foster's European partnership, a joint venture between FBG and Scottish and Newcastle Plc, FBG said.
"Growth in continental Europe has exceeded 60 percent in the last five years," Foster's International senior vice-president Richard Scully said in a statement.
"This major new licensing agreement with San Miguel is consistent with the Foster's European partnership strategy for the brand..."
